title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Braccini M (2022). diffeRenTES: Computation Attractor Transition Matrix (ATM) Threshold Ergodic Set-Based Cell Differentiation Process (Synchronous) Boolean Networks. R package version 0.2.2.
code: @Manual{,   title = {diffeRenTES: Computation of Attractor Transition Matrix (ATM) and Threshold Ergodic Set-Based Cell Differentiation Process from (Synchronous) Boolean Networks},   author = {Michele Braccini},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.2.2}, }

title: Computation of Attractor Transition Matrix (ATM) and Threshold Ergodic Set-Based Cell Differentiation Process from (Synchronous) Boolean Networks
text: diffeRenTES (French various, different) package written R , starting Boolean networks BoolNet package, computes ATM (Attractor Transition Matrix) structure tree-like structure, based TES concept, describing cell differentiation process. TESs (Threshold Ergodic Sets) mathematical abstractions represent different cell types arising ontogenesis. TESs powerful model biological differentiation based Boolean networks belongs firstly described “Dynamical Model Genetic Networks Cell Differentiation” Villani M, Barbieri , Serra R (2011) Dynamical Model Genetic Networks Cell Differentiation. PLOS ONE 6 (3): e17703. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0017703

title: Computation of Attractor Transition Matrix (ATM) and Threshold Ergodic Set-Based Cell Differentiation Process from (Synchronous) Boolean Networks
text: package requires folowing R libraries: BoolNet igraph DOT

title: Computation of Attractor Transition Matrix (ATM) and Threshold Ergodic Set-Based Cell Differentiation Process from (Synchronous) Boolean Networks
code: net <- BoolNet::generateRandomNKNetwork(10, 2)     attractors <- BoolNet::getAttractors(net)      ATM <- computeATM(net, attractors) # attractors transition matrix computation     TESs <- computeTESs(ATM) #TESs computation     saveDotFileDifferentiationTree(TESs, "exampleTree") #saving the TES-based differentiation tree

title: Compute ATM — getATM
text: getATM returns ATM (Attractor Transistion Matrix) structure.  ATM computes probability transition attractors Boolean network upon introduction noise form logic negation node state attractor,  checking attractor dynamics relaxes. diagonal ATM accounts attractor robustness, diagonal values represent probability returning attractor perturbation.

title: Compute ATM — getATM
Compute ATM — getATM
text: net Boolean network previously loaded loadNetwork() BoolNet package syncAttractors Synchronous attractors Boolean network MAX_STEPS_TO_FIND_ATTRACTORS Number steps dynamics perturbation gives

title: Compute ATM — getATM
text: output named list containing computed ATM structure, number lost flips (.e., number perturbations reach another attractor within provided MAX_STEPS_TO_FIND_ATTRACTORS), lastly attractors two formats: one returned BoolNet package (called decimal) binary translation (called binary).

title: Compute ATM — getATM
code: net <- BoolNet::generateRandomNKNetwork(10, 2) attractors <- BoolNet::getAttractors(net)  getATM(net, attractors) #> $ATM #>      a1   a2  a3 #> a1 0.50 0.00 0.5 #> a2 0.10 0.40 0.5 #> a3 0.22 0.08 0.7 #>  #> $lostFLips #> [1] 0 #>  #> $attractors #> $attractors$decimal #> $attractors$decimal$a1 #> $attractors$decimal$a1$involvedStates #>      [,1] #> [1,]  978 #>  #> $attractors$decimal$a1$basinSize #> [1] 280 #>  #>  #> $attractors$decimal$a2 #> $attractors$decimal$a2$involvedStates #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] #> [1,]  409 1003  855  462 #>  #> $attractors$decimal$a2$basinSize #> [1] 120 #>  #>  #> $attractors$decimal$a3 #> $attractors$decimal$a3$involvedStates #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] [,5] #> [1,]  464  923  994  595  974 #>  #> $attractors$decimal$a3$basinSize #> [1] 624 #>  #>  #>  #> $attractors$binary #> $attractors$binary$a1 #>        [,1] #> Gene1     0 #> Gene2     1 #> Gene3     0 #> Gene4     0 #> Gene5     1 #> Gene6     0 #> Gene7     1 #> Gene8     1 #> Gene9     1 #> Gene10    1 #>  #> $attractors$binary$a2 #>        [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] #> Gene1     1    1    1    0 #> Gene2     0    1    1    1 #> Gene3     0    0    1    1 #> Gene4     1    1    0    1 #> Gene5     1    0    1    0 #> Gene6     0    1    0    0 #> Gene7     0    1    1    1 #> Gene8     1    1    0    1 #> Gene9     1    1    1    1 #> Gene10    0    1    1    0 #>  #> $attractors$binary$a3 #>        [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] [,5] #> Gene1     0    1    0    1    0 #> Gene2     0    1    1    1    1 #> Gene3     0    0    0    0    1 #> Gene4     0    1    0    0    1 #> Gene5     1    1    0    1    0 #> Gene6     0    0    1    0    0 #> Gene7     1    0    1    1    1 #> Gene8     1    1    1    0    1 #> Gene9     1    1    1    0    1 #> Gene10    0    1    1    1    1 #>  #>  #>

what: Generates a DOT tree-like representation of the TESs — getDifferentiationTreeAsDOTString
title: Generates a DOT tree-like representation of the TESs — getDifferentiationTreeAsDOTString
text: getDifferentiationTreeAsDOTString returns description computed TES-based differentiation tree using DOT Language. returned DOT description can passed saveDotFileDifferentiationTree order save file local filesystem.

title: Generates a DOT tree-like representation of the TESs — getDifferentiationTreeAsDOTString
Generates a DOT tree-like representation of the TESs — getDifferentiationTreeAsDOTString
Generates a DOT tree-like representation of the TESs — getDifferentiationTreeAsDOTString
text: string describe computed TES-based differentiation tree using DOT Language.

title: Generates a DOT tree-like representation of the TESs — getDifferentiationTreeAsDOTString
code: net <- BoolNet::generateRandomNKNetwork(10, 2) attractors <- BoolNet::getAttractors(net)  ATM <- getATM(net, attractors) TESs <- getTESs(ATM)  #> [1] "There is no threshold value equal to 0 in the ATM, I will add it for the TESs computation" dotString <- getDifferentiationTreeAsDOTString

title: Compute TES — getTESs
text: Creates structure constructing TES described "Dynamical Model Genetic Networks Cell Differentiation  Villani M, Barbieri , Serra R (2011) Dynamical Model Genetic Networks Cell Differentiation. PLOS ONE 6(3): e17703. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0017703"

title: Compute TES — getTESs
Compute TES — getTESs
text: ATM ATM structured returned getATM method

title: Compute TES — getTESs
text: output named list contains list computed TESs, noise thresholds emerged lastly ATM structure.

title: Compute TES — getTESs
code: net <- BoolNet::generateRandomNKNetwork(10, 2) attractors <- BoolNet::getAttractors(net)  ATM <- getATM(net, attractors) getTESs(ATM)  #> $TES #> $TES$level_0 #> $TES$level_0$TES_1 #> [1] "a1" "a2" "a3" "a4" "a5" "a6" "a7" "a8" #>  #>  #> $TES$level_1 #> $TES$level_1$TES_2 #> [1] "a1" "a2" "a3" "a4" "a5" "a6" "a7" "a8" #>  #>  #> $TES$level_2 #> $TES$level_2$TES_3 #> [1] "a1" "a2" "a3" "a4" "a5" "a6" "a7" "a8" #>  #>  #> $TES$level_3 #> $TES$level_3$TES_4 #> [1] "a1" "a3" #>  #> $TES$level_3$TES_5 #> [1] "a4" #>  #> $TES$level_3$TES_6 #> [1] "a5" #>  #> $TES$level_3$TES_7 #> [1] "a6" #>  #> $TES$level_3$TES_8 #> [1] "a7" "a8" #>  #>  #> $TES$level_4 #> $TES$level_4$TES_9 #> [1] "a1" "a3" #>  #> $TES$level_4$TES_10 #> [1] "a2" #>  #> $TES$level_4$TES_11 #> [1] "a4" #>  #> $TES$level_4$TES_12 #> [1] "a5" #>  #> $TES$level_4$TES_13 #> [1] "a6" #>  #> $TES$level_4$TES_14 #> [1] "a7" #>  #>  #> $TES$level_5 #> $TES$level_5$TES_15 #> [1] "a1" "a3" #>  #> $TES$level_5$TES_16 #> [1] "a2" #>  #> $TES$level_5$TES_17 #> [1] "a4" #>  #> $TES$level_5$TES_18 #> [1] "a5" #>  #> $TES$level_5$TES_19 #> [1] "a6" #>  #> $TES$level_5$TES_20 #> [1] "a7" #>  #> $TES$level_5$TES_21 #> [1] "a8" #>  #>  #> $TES$level_6 #> $TES$level_6$TES_22 #> [1] "a1" #>  #> $TES$level_6$TES_23 #> [1] "a2" #>  #> $TES$level_6$TES_24 #> [1] "a3" #>  #> $TES$level_6$TES_25 #> [1] "a4" #>  #> $TES$level_6$TES_26 #> [1] "a5" #>  #> $TES$level_6$TES_27 #> [1] "a6" #>  #> $TES$level_6$TES_28 #> [1] "a7" #>  #> $TES$level_6$TES_29 #> [1] "a8" #>  #>  #> $TES$level_7 #> $TES$level_7$TES_30 #> "a6" #>  #> $TES$level_7$TES_36 #> [1] "a7" #>  #> $TES$level_7$TES_37 #> [1] "a8" #>  #>  #>  #> $thresholds #> [1] 0.00 0.05 0.10 0.15 0.20 0.25 0.30 0.35 #>  #> $ATM #> $ATM$ATM #>      a1   a2   a3   a4   a5   a6   a7   a8 #> a1 0.30 0.05 0.30 0.10 0.10 0.10 0.05 0.00 #> a2 0.05 0.30 0.20 0.20 0.10 0.00 0.05 0.10 #> a3 0.30 0.10 0.30 0.05 0.05 0.15 0.05 0.00 #> a4 0.15 0.15 0.05 0.35 0.00 what: Save differentiation tree's DOT representation into a file — saveDotFileDifferentiationTree
title: Save differentiation tree's DOT representation into a file — saveDotFileDifferentiationTree
text: saveDotFileDifferentiationTree saves DOT representation derived differentiation tree file.

title: Save differentiation tree's DOT representation into a file — saveDotFileDifferentiationTree
Save differentiation tree's DOT representation into a file — saveDotFileDifferentiationTree
text: DOTRep Representation TES-based differentiation tree computed using getDifferentiationTreeAsDOTString filename filename .gv file saveImage Logical parameter indicating whether saveDotFileDifferentiationTree produce also image tree, .svg format.

title: Save differentiation tree's DOT representation into a file — saveDotFileDifferentiationTree
Save differentiation tree's DOT representation into a file — saveDotFileDifferentiationTree
code: if (FALSE) { net <- BoolNet::generateRandomNKNetwork(10, 2) attractors <- BoolNet::getAttractors(net)  ATM <- getATM(net, attractors) TESs <- getTESs(ATM)  dotString <- getDifferentiationTreeAsDOTString(TESs) saveDotFileDifferentiationTree(dotString, "exampleTree") }
